items.preText:
7.40 pm Welcome back. Chases haven't been all that lucky for teams in this Asia Cup but India's captain Rohit Sharma did say that the ball came onto the bat better under lights in Dubai. Additionally, he's been in form, which means a target of 174 should prove rather straightforward. Still, with Mustafizur Rahman and Mehidy Hasan in their ranks, Bangladesh might fancy pulling off an upset - but for that they need to get into India's middle order quickly. That's where the problems lie.

Adi: "Dis someone notice the 4 catches by Dhawan.. i am sure it is not a record by a Non-wicketkeeper fieder. But what is the record?" --- Jonty Rhodes sits at the top of the pile with five

Snehil: "The only team India need to be wary of is Afghanistan. They are looking very dangerous and are beating teams comprehensively (just have a look at the other match going on). Also, they have never faced them in an ODI before. Hope, the experience of facing their lead bowlers in the IPL helps them."
items.text: gets up tall to drill a back of a length delivery into the covers
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Sharma, no run

items.text: a hint of swing for Mashrafe as he hits a good length outside off, but it's nothing to trouble the batsman as Rohit eases it to cover point
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Sharma, no run

items.text: nice and full again and Rohit, as he usually is, stays cautious early in his innings
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Sharma, no run

items.text: drives on the up and the ball clatters into the cover boundary. Outrageous batting, comes out of a solid front foot push and quick decision to exploit the width on offer
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Sharma, FOUR runs

items.text: he's a little more circumspect when there isn't so much room outside off, defending the good length ball
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Sharma, no run

items.text: strong in defence now
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Sharma, no run

items.preText: Mehidy Hasan from round the wicket. One slip in
items.text: waits on the offbreak to come to him and then slices it in front of point
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Dhawan, no run

items.text: short again but Dhawan isn't able to take advantage, his forceful push off the back foot finding cover
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Dhawan, no run

items.text: slows it down and tosses it up outside off and that change in length makes Dhawan suspicious. Checks his shot as he drives to point
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Dhawan, no run

items.text: rocks back against the short ball and flicks it to deep square leg
items.postText: Saurabh: "Waiting for Rubel Hossain vs Rohit Sharma contest. It kinda brings back old memories;)"
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Dhawan, 1 run

items.text: he's reaching in front of his body to make contact with a beautiful offbreak, dangled outside off. And try as he might, he can't get to the pitch, which is why it goes uppishly over to long-on
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Sharma, 1 run

items.text: sliding into the pads of the left-hander, who easily works him away to deep square leg
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Dhawan, 1 run

items.preText: Lakshmikanth: "Comparing the two Asia cup matches today, what do you think is right.. Did India bowl better than Pakistan? OR did Afghanistan bat better than Bangladesh? " #CricketWorldProblems
items.text: runs in from round the wicket and cramps him up with a good length ball on off stump. Dhawan keeps it out
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Dhawan, no run

items.text: firm front foot defence from Dhawan, the ball pinging off the middle to cover
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Dhawan, no run

items.text: carves it over point! Far too much room given to a man who absolutely loves it there. Lunges forward and lashes it away, no intention of keeping it down
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Dhawan, FOUR runs

items.text: again! This time along the ground and through extra cover! Mashrafe doesn't quite adjust his line well enough and has to go back to his mark grumbling. Dhawan, meanwhile, simply admires the shot, his free-flowing swing of the bat makes it end up behind his back
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Dhawan, FOUR runs

items.text: works it off his toes to midwicket
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Dhawan, no run

items.text: slower ball from the Bangladesh captain, Dhawan drills it to cover
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Dhawan, no run

items.preText: Ganesh: "Why isn't the Fizz bowling he has got the Hitman 3 out of 4 times why allow him to settle down at all." Perhaps Bangladesh want the ball to get older before giving it to their master cutter
items.text: flighted delivery around the off stump, Rohit steers it to point
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Sharma, no run

items.text: clips it off his pads to short fine leg
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Sharma, no run

items.text: waits on the flatter delivery, clips it to the right of midwicket and sets off
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Sharma, 1 run

items.text: misfield at cover - Dhawan does hit them hard and he leaned into this drive with great conviction
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Dhawan, 2 runs

items.text: width again and Dhawan lays into it with a slap to long-off
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Dhawan, 1 run

items.text: neat little deflection to deep midwicket, Rohit playing close to the body, and judging length ever so perfectly
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Sharma, 1 run

items.preText: Varun Deshpande: "Why Bangladesh didn't start with Mustafizur... Rohit has proven issue with left arm fast bowler at starting of inning..Mashrafe missed the trick or good batting of mehandy and himself boost his confidence to start with him." --- Well here he is. With a slip in tow
items.text: 126 kph - might well be the cutter to start off. Rohit holds his shape (just about well enough) and blocks to point
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Sharma, no run
